<callout> Sometimes people ask me...</callout>

@cr-question

::: {#cr-question}
<subcallout>"   Why do you love space so much?   "</subcallout>
:::

<callout>Besides it being...</callout>
@cr-pretty

::: {#cr-pretty}
<subcallout>Beautiful and Mystifying?</subcallout>
:::

<subcallout>The best I can do is direct you to an excerpt</subcallout>

@cr-sagan

::: {#cr-sagan}
<subcallout>Written by American astronomer and planetary scientist, Carl Sagan.</subcallout>
:::

@cr-sagan-1

::: {#cr-sagan-1}
<readout>
The size and age of the Cosmos are [beyond ordinary human understanding]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.<br>
Lost somewhere between [immensity and eternity]{style="color:#8669c9;"} is our [tiny planetary home]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.
</readout>
:::

@cr-sagan-2

::: {#cr-sagan-2}
<readout>
And yet our species, is young and curious and brave and [shows much promise]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.<br>
In the last few millennia, we have made the most astonishing and unexpected discoveries.
</readout>
:::

@cr-sagan-3

::: {#cr-sagan-3}
<readout>
They remind us that [humans have evolved]{style="color:#8669c9;"} to wonder, that [understanding is a joy]{style="color:#8669c9;"}, that [knowledge is prerequisite to survival]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.
</readout>
:::

@cr-sagan-4

::: {#cr-sagan-4}
<readout>
Our little planet floats like a mote of dust in the morning sky. All that you see, all that we can see,<br>
exploded out of [a star]{style="color:#8669c9;"} billions of years ago, and the particles slowly arranged themselves into living things, [including all of us]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.
</readout>
:::

@cr-sagan-5

::: {#cr-sagan-5}
<readout>
We are made of star stuff. [We are the mechanism by which the universe can comprehend itself]{style="color:#8669c9;"}.<br>
The [world is so exquisite]{style="color:#8669c9;"} with so much love and moral depth.
</readout>
:::

@cr-sagan-6

::: {#cr-sagan-6}
<readout>
[We should remain grateful every day for the brief but magnificent opportunity that life provides...]{style="color:#8669c9;"}
</readout>
:::
